Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the severity of the poverty rate amongst women by stating that it is the worst it has been in 17 years and the extreme poverty rate is the worst it has ever been.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide specific data or sources to support the statement about the poverty rate amongst women being the worst in 17 years.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the poverty rate amongst women is solely due to government spending, regulation, and taxes without considering other factors.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider other possible factors contributing to the poverty rate amongst women, such as the wage gap and systemic inequalities.
